intro: Lasallea patens, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, often opening in the morning. Lasallea patens is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering vines and herbs. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
